Description: Penannular glazed composition ear- or hair-ring, with convex outer face. Heavily fired glazed composition.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Initially catalogued as glass, but is actually heavily fired glazed composition. Comes from a group of objects published by Petrie (1891, 17, pl. XVII) as the "Group of Tutankhamen".
Bibliographic references: Bell 1991 / The Tutankhamun Burnt Group from Gurob: Egypt: Bases for the Absolute Chronology of LH III A and B (p.82 and p. 666 (Jewellery19)) (Bell gives "faience" as material.)
Petrie 1891 / Illahun, Kahun and Gurob (p. 17, pl. XVII(?))
